author: pipistrelle
title: Amazing detail in such a small set
review:
This set is a very good example of the Creator series - use a set of basic bricks to create realistic and enjoyable models.  The pieces themselves are mostly very small; cheese wedges, small round plates and other small plates and bricks, but they come in nice range of colours.  The only really large parts are the wheels and tyres and the 'Z' shaped piece used to hitch the trailer to the tractor unit.

The helicopter is cute (but I like helicopters, be they Technic, City or Creator) with lots of little details for the engine.  The tractor unit is very cleverly designed with smoked trans. bricks for the windows and a blue, white and orange stripe paint job (although the stripes don't quite match up round the side fairings).

The helicopter sits neatly on the trailer and is fixed in place with one stud each side.  This is enough, however, to sometimes cause it leave behind its skids when it takes off.

The two alternative models are equally as good.  Overall, modelling in miniature at its best!

author: Gary_Bricks
title: Best value Creator set for Spring 2011!
review:
5 stars painted all over this set!

I'll start off with the Helicopter shall I?

The Helicopter is my favorite part of the main model. It has very nice engine details, with a metallic silver radiator grill brick. The bright yellow nose cone is also very handy. It has simple landing pads and an adjustable back wing, also at the back is a small rotor.

The Truck

Overall very well detailed. Interesting pieces include the piece used for placing the lights and the bumper on Lego City Cars is used. Still scattered with amazing detail that will leave you in all
